Trade Floor Risk Management (TFRM) is an independent arm of the bank that provides market risk oversight for the bank s trading, balance sheet and liquidity management activities. It ensures that these activities are in line with bank s risk appetite by producing detailed and regular risk reports and analysis, designing and monitoring limits, by maintaining an active dialogue with the business units and, when required, escalating concerns to appropriate levels of management. TFRM is responsible for validating regulatory metrics such as those produced as per the Volcker Rule. It is also responsible for formulating valuation and market risk management policies and is a key stakeholder in monthly/quarterly/yearly valuation processes.
The TFRM XVA team within the oversees the XVA desk within Global Banking and Markets (GBM) which includes managing of the Credit Valuation Adjustment (CVA / DVA), Funding Valuation Adjustment (FVA) and Collateral Valuation Adjustment (ColVA). The team also works closely with other relevant teams covering derivatives trading in rates, credit, FX, Energy and Equity asset classes in locations expanding Toronto, London, New York, Singapore and the Pacific Alliance
This is an excellent role for a highly motivated individual aspiring to consolidate a career in market risk management. The successful candidate will have opportunity to deepen her understanding of OTC derivative products and related valuation adjustments, and market risk arising from trading the same.

Market Risk   Oversee market risk exposures for the XVA desk and communicate to TFRM management on trading risks, trader sentiment and market conditions. Help ensure adherence with Bank s risk appetite and the business' mandate. Review daily P&L, risk and limit reports, and engage in discussions with the global team and trading management as appropriate.
Daily oversight of XVA calculation and support of XVA desk, e.g. producing daily CVA summary and analytics, supporting XVA configurations, coordinate one-off investigation and impact analysis.
Partnership with Trading   Engage trading groups in a proactive manner to promote open communication between risk and trading.
Limit Adjudication   Review and make recommendations to TFRM management on limit change requests.
Communication   Communicate regularly with TFRM management on trading activity, trading risk profile, trader sentiment and market developments in covered businesses. Collaborate with other Bank and GRM stakeholders to achieve common objectives.
Regulatory & Audit   Participate in external and internal audits and resolution of findings and participate in key regulatory initiatives (e.g. FRTB).
Technology   Participate in enhancement / upgrade of production and risk systems as needed (i.e. Qlikview, Tableau etc.)
